column4: Hello, I have the $FILE='my file' variable which contains a file name.. the $FILE changes all the time so i want to put the '\' before every ' ' char in order to can use it with the mv command?? how is possible to put \ before every space character? it has to be something with sed right?
Or at least I want somehow to be able to rename the file with a string contained in a variable without to care about the space
You can just wrap it in ""
what do you mean? i want to do: mv *txt $FILE.txt ....  But what if $FILE= "name with spaces"
